MixTank¶

class biosteam.units.MixTank(ID='', ins=None, outs=(), thermo=None, *, vessel_type='Conventional', tau=1, V_wf=0.8, vessel_material='Stainless steel', kW_per_m3=0.0985)[source]¶

Create a mixing tank with volume based on residence time.

Parameters

  • ins (streams) – Inlet fluids to be mixed.

  • outs (stream) – Outlet.

  • vessel_type (str) – Vessel type.

  • tau=1 (float) – Residence time [hr].

  • V_wf=0.8 (float) – Fraction of working volume over total volume.

  • vessel_material (str, optional) – Vessel material. Defaults to ‘Stainless steel’.

  • kW_per_m3=0.0985 (float) – Electricity requirement per unit volume [kW/m^3].

Notes

For a detailed discussion on the design and cost algorithm, please read the Tank documentation.

The purchase cost algorithm is based on 1.

References

1

Apostolakou, A. A., Kookos, I. K., Marazioti, C., Angelopoulos, K. C. (2009). Techno-economic analysis of a biodiesel production process from vegetable oils. Fuel Processing Technology, 90(7–8), 1023–1031. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.fuproc.2009.04.017

tau = None¶

[float] Residence time in hours.

V_wf = None¶

[float] Fraction of working volume to total volume.

property vessel_material¶

[str] Vessel construction material.

property F_mass_in¶

Net mass flow going in [kg/hr].

property F_mass_out¶

Net mass flow going out [kg/hr].

property F_mol_in¶

Net molar flow going in [kmol/hr].

property F_mol_out¶

Net molar flow going out [kmol/hr].

property F_vol_in¶

Net volumetric flow going in [m3/hr].

property F_vol_out¶

Net volumetric flow going out [m3/hr].

property H_in¶

Enthalpy flow going in [kJ/hr].

property H_out¶

Enthalpy flow going out [kJ/hr].

property Hf_in¶

Enthalpy of formation flow going in [kJ/hr].

property Hf_out¶

Enthalpy of formation flow going out [kJ/hr].

property Hnet¶

Net enthalpy flow, including enthalpies of formation [kJ/hr].

property ID¶

Unique identification (str). If set as ‘’, it will choose a default ID.

diagram(radius=0, upstream=True, downstream=True, file=None, format='png', **graph_attrs)¶

Display a Graphviz diagram of the unit and all neighboring units within given radius.

Parameters

  • radius (int) – Maxium number streams between neighbors.

  • downstream=True (bool, optional) – Whether to show downstream operations

  • upstream=True (bool, optional) – Whether to show upstream operations

  • file (Must be one of the following:) –

    • [str] File name to save diagram.

    • [None] Display diagram in console.

  • format (str) – Format of file.

property ins¶

All input streams.

property installation_cost¶

Installation cost [USD].

property mass_in¶

Mass flows going in [kg/hr].

property mass_out¶

Mass flows going out [kg/hr].

property mol_in¶

Molar flows going in [kmol/hr].

property mol_out¶

Molar flows going out [kmol/hr].

property numerical_specification¶

Numerical design or process specification.

property outs¶

All output streams.

property purchase_cost¶

Total purchase cost [USD].

purchase_cost_algorithms¶

VesselPurchaseCostAlgorithm] All cost algorithms available for vessel types.

Type

dict[str

results(with_units=True, include_utilities=True, include_total_cost=True)¶

Return key results from simulation as a DataFrame if with_units is True or as a Series otherwise.

show(T=None, P=None, flow=None, composition=False, N=None)¶

Prints information on unit.

simulate()¶

Run rigourous simulation and determine all design requirements. No design specifications are solved.

property utility_cost¶

Total utility cost [USD/hr].

property vol_in¶

Volumetric flows going in [m3/hr].

property vol_out¶

Volumetric flows going out [m3/hr].

property z_mass_in¶

Mass fractions going in.

property z_mass_out¶

Mass fractions going out.

property z_mol_in¶

Molar fractions going in [kmol/hr].

property z_mol_out¶

Molar fractions going in.

property z_vol_in¶

Volumetric fractions going in.

property z_vol_out¶

Volumetric fractions going out.
